column2: OTE: The following variable, AMDELT, identifies an adult as having a major depressive episode (MDE) in their lifetime and AMDEYR
identifies an adult as having MDE in the prior year. Beginning in 2021, missing values for AMDELT and AMDEYR were replaced using statistical
imputation. The imputation-revised variables used in analysis, IRAMDELT and IRAMDEYR, appear in the Imputed Adult Depression section.
respondent was classified as having a major depressive episode (MDE) in their lifetime, AMDELT=1, if they reported experiencing at least five

column1: out of the nine criteria used to define an adult as having had MDE in their lifetime, where at least one of the criteria is a depressed mood or loss of

column2: interest or pleasure in daily activities (ADSMMDEA=1). An adult was classified as NOT having a major depressive episode (MDE) in their
lifetime, AMDELT=2, if they met either of these conditions:
Reported experiencing fewer than five out of the nine criteria used to define an adult as having had MDE in their lifetime
If the number of criteria used to define an adult as having had MDE in their lifetime is unknown (ADSMMDEA=94,97,98) and the
respondent reported at least one of the following:

column4: Never having had a period of time lasting several days or longer when felt sad, empty, or depressed (ADDPREV=2),
discouraged about how things were going in life (ADDSCEV=2), and lost interest in most things usually enjoyable

column3: Experienced the feelings in (i), but they did not last most of the day, nearly every day for two weeks or longer

column4: Experienced the feelings in (i) most of the day, nearly every day for two weeks or longer, but the feelings lasted less than an

column3: hour when mood was most severe and frequent (ADWRHRS=1).

column4: Experienced the feelings in (i) most of the day, nearly every day for two weeks or longer for at least an hour during those
times when mood was most severe and frequent, but emotional distress was mild (ADWRDST=1), there was never a time
when emotional distress was so severe that you could not be cheered up (ADWRCHR=4), and there was never a time when

column3: your emotional distress was so severe that you could not carry out your daily activities (ADWRIMP=4).

column4: Experienced the feelings in (i) most of the day, nearly every day for two weeks or longer for at least an hour and the severe
distress were more than mild or at some point could not be cheered up or could not carry out daily activities, but never had
any other problems during those weeks, such as changes in sleep, appetite, energy, the ability to concentrate and remember,

column2: ADDPPROB, ADDPR2WK, ADDPREV, ADDSCEV, ADLOSEV, ADLSI2WK, ADSMMDEA, ADWRCHR, ADWRDST, ADWRHRS, ADWRIMP)
